intro: Taligalea, commonly known as the golden lily, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the genus Taligalea within the family Melanthiaceae. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Taligalea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
